operator.name: Complexity Metrics (Petri Net)
operator.Synopyis: Calculates complexity metrics for a Petri net.
operator.help: Calculates complexity metrics for a Petri net. Implements metrics describe in the article: Complexity metrics for Workflow nets and some more. Implemented metrics are: 'Extended Cardoso metric', 'Extended Cyclomatic metric', 'Structuredness metric', 'Density metric', 'Number of arcs', 'Number of transitions' and 'Number of places'.

operator.name: Filter Unmapped Events
operator.Synopyis: Removes events that are not mapped to any transition in the supplied mapping.
operator.help: Removes events that are not mapped to any transition in the supplied mapping.

operator.name: Filter Out Low-Occurrence Traces
operator.Synopyis: Filters a log using an absolute threshold. Traces that do not appear often enough, will be filtered out.
operator.help: Filters a log using an absolute threshold. Traces that do not appear often enough, will be filtered out.

operator.name: Filter In High-Frequency Traces
operator.Synopyis: Filters a log using a frequency threshold (a percentage) and a distance threshold (edit distance).
operator.help: Filters a log using a frequency threshold (a percentage) and a distance threshold (edit distance). Any trace that either, (1) has a high-enough frequency or, (2) is close enough to a trace with high-enough frequency will be filtered in. A trace has high-enough frequency if its frequency is required to reach the overall frequency threshold.

operator.name: Compare Alpha Relations
operator.synopsis: Compares the directly follows relation of two logs
operator.help: Compares the directly follows relation of two logs. The first log is used as a reference, the second log is used to determine true/false positives/negatives

operator.name: Project Alignment on DPN
operator.Synopyis: Projects an aligned log on a Data Petri net.
operator.help: Projects an aligned log on a Data Petri net.

operator.name: Only contain lifecycle 'complete' events
operator.Synopyis: Removes all events with another lifecycle than 'complete'

operator.name: Add noisy activities to event log
operator.Synopyis: Adds noisy activities to log

operator.name: Apply projection set to log
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (greedy)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (direct, alpha=1/d)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (direct)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (beam)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (greedy3)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (greedy2)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply entropy-based projections to log (global)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply KL-divergence-based projections to log (greedy)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply frequency-based projections to log (ascendingly)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply frequency-based projections to log (descendingly)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply random projections to log
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Apply adjusted entropy-based projections to log (greedy)
operator.Synopyis: Returns a collection of logs, with iteratively one activity removed from the original log

operator.name: Calculate determinism
operator.Synopyis: Calculates determinism

operator.name: Calculate ETC 1-align precision
operator.Synopyis: Calculate precision using 1-align ETC conformance
operator.help: This technique uses the Align-ETC precision measurement plugin from ProM. The underlying technique is explained here

operator.name: Calculate negative event precision
operator.Synopyis: Calculate precision using weighted negative events

operator.name: Measure Model Precision based on alignments
operator.synopsis: Measures model precision and generalization based on pre-calculated alignments
operator.help: This technique is defined in here. For this operator, you need alignments (PNRepResult) as input.

operator.name: Mine a sequential model
operator.synopsis: DO NOT USE THIS OPERATOR (Experimental)

operator.name: Import CPN Model
operator.synopsis: Import CPN Model
operator.help: This operator imports a coloured-Petri net. These can be obtained from other tools such as CPN tools.

operator.name: Import Static Event Stream
operator.synopsis: Import a static event stream
operator.help: Allows for importing a static event stream. Static event streams allow us to do repeated experiments using the same event stream.

operator.name: Add Source and Sink to Petri net
operator.synopsis: This operator creates an artificial and single source and sink places in a petri net

operator.name: ActivityList to Petri net
operator.synopsis: This operator creates a sequential Petri net based on an activity name list extracted from a data table

operator.name: Soundness Analysis (Woflan)
operator.synopsis: This operator analyzes the soundness of a Petri net using the Woflan workflow diagnosis tool, as defined in here.
operator.help: This operator analyzes the soundness of a Petri net using the Woflan workflow diagnosis tool, as defined in here. For using this operator, you need a Petri net.

operator.name: Feature Prediction (Decision Trees)
operator.synopsis: This operator performs Predictions of Business Process Features, as defined in here.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need an event log. The actual tool will be launched when visualized.

operator.name: Conformance Checking
operator.synopsis: This operator replays a log into a Petri net and show visual results, as described in here.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a Petri net and a log.

operator.name: Conformance Checking (Iterative A*)
operator.synopsis: This operator replays a log into a Petri net and show visual results. Using an iterative A* approach.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a Petri net and a log.

operator.name: Inductive Visual Miner
operator.synopsis: This operator creates a process model using the Inductive Visual Miner as described in: here.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need an event log.

operator.name: Visualize Model using PomPom (visualization)
operator.synopsis: This operator shows a PomPom view over a PetriNet. The PomPom operator visualizes a Petri-net/EPC that emphasizes those parts of the process that correspond to high-frequent events in a given log. The visualizer will attempt to reduce low-frequent transitions/functions as much as possible.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a petri net and a log.

operator.name: Discover Process Data Flow (Decision Tree)
operator.synopsis: This operator transforms a Petri net into a Desicion tree
operator.help: For using this operator, you need petri net and a log.

operator.name: Extract Petri Nets from LPM ranking
operator.synopsis: This operator extracts Petri nets objects from a ranking of Local Process Models.
operator.help: To use this operator you need a Local Process Model ranking as input

operator.name: Data Conformance Checking
operator.synopsis: This operator replays a log onto a Data Petri net.
operator.help: This operator replays a log onto a Data Petri net as described in here.

operator.name: Petri Net to BPMN
operator.synopsis: This operator transforms a Petri net into a BPMN diagram. The conversion used is described in here.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a petri net as input.

operator.name: Petri Net to Data Petri net
operator.synopsis: This operator transforms a Petri net into a Data Petri net.
operator.help: This operator transforms a Petri net into a Data Petri net. The Data Petri net has the same structure as the Petri net, and, initially no variables and guards.

operator.name: Transition System to Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator transforms a Transition System (Reachability Graph) into a petri net, using Petrify.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a transition system (reachability graph).

operator.name: Petri Net to Reachability Graph
operator.synopsis: This operator transforms a petri net into a Transition System (Reachability Graph), using Petrify.
operator.help: For using this operator, you need a petri net.

operator.name: Import Accepting Petri Net
operator.synopsis: Import an Accepting Petri Net
operator.help: This operator imports an accepting Petri net (a Petri net with initial and final markings).

operator.name: Import Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator is used to import a Petri net in a pnml format
operator.help: This operator can be used to read a PNML file. PNML files that are accepted are the ones that are produced by ProM itself or the ones that are produced by Yasper. As input a pnml file is needed.

operator.name: Import Data Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator is used to import a Data Petri net from a PNML file
operator.help: This operator can be used to read a Data Petri net from a PNML file. Also normal Petri nets are accepted.

operator.name: Animate Log in Fuzzy Graph
operator.synopsis: This operator is used to animate (replay) an event log into a fuzzy graph as described in here.
operator.help: For using this operator, an event log, and a Fuzzy Graph are necessary as inputs.

operator.name: Import Event Log
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to import a ProM XES event log from a file.
operator.help: This operator can be used to import a ProM XES event log file. Note that only .xes files can be read.

operator.name: Extract Event Log
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to read a ProM XES log file from a file object (useful for loops over file collections)
operator.help: This operator can be used to read a ProM XES log file

operator.name: Extract Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to read a ProM Pnml petrinet file from a file object (useful for loops over file collections)
operator.help: This operator can be used to read a ProM Pnml petrinet file

operator.name: Sort chronologically
operator.synopsis: This operator sorts traces and events within traces by timestamp (increasing).
operator.help: This operator sorts traces and events within traces by timestamp.

operator.name: Filter Infrequent Behavior (Log Automaton)
operator.synopsis: Event log filter able to filter out infrequent behavior. Based on: Conforti, R., La Rosa, M., and, ter Hofstede, A.; Filtering Out Infrequent Behavior from Business Process Event Logs"; IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering, Vol 29., No 2.
operator.help: Event log filter able to filter out infrequent behavior. The filter creates an automaton based on the event log and uses the threshold to filter out infrequent transitions within the automaton. Based on: Conforti, R., La Rosa, M., and, ter Hofstede, A.; Filtering Out Infrequent Behavior from Business Process Event Logs"; IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering, Vol 29., No 2.

operator.name: Matrix Filter
operator.help: LONGER HELP

operator.name: Sequence Filter
operator.help: LONGER HELP

operator.name: Alpha Miner (Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the Alpha algorithm.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the Alpha algorithm which provides a Petri Net and a Marking. As input a log file is needed.

operator.name: Causal Graph (Flexible Heuristics Miner)
operator.synopsis: This operator discovers a causal graph, based on the Flexible Heuristics Miner.
operator.help: This operator discovers a causal graph, based on the Flexible Heuristics Miner as described in: Weijters, A. J. M. M., and J. T. S. Ribeiro. "Flexible heuristics miner (FHM)." Computational Intelligence and Data Mining (CIDM), 2011 IEEE Symposium on. IEEE, 2011.

operator.name: Data-aware Heuristic Miner (Causal net)
operator.synopsis: This operator discovers a causal net (C-net), based on the Data-aware Heuristic Miner.
operator.help: This operator discovers a causal net (C-net), based on the Data-aware Heuristic Miner as described in: TODO

operator.name: ILP Miner (Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the ILP Miner discovery algorithm.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the ILP Miner algorithm which provides a Petri Net and a marking. As input a log file is needed.

operator.name: Local Process Model Discovery
operator.synopsis: This operator mines a collection of Petri Nets that describe local behavior in the process, using the algorithm described in: https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.06066.
operator.help: This operator can be used to mine a collection of Petri Nets that describe local behavior in the process

operator.name: Diversify Local Process Model ranking by filtering
operator.synopsis: This operator filters out similar Local Process Models to diversity the obtained Local Process Model ranking
operator.help: This operator filters out similar Local Process Models to diversity the obtained Local Process Model ranking

operator.name: Diversify Local Process Model ranking by re-ranking
operator.synopsis: This operator re-ranks out the Local Process Models by taking into account a new diversity score as well as the old LPM score
operator.help: This operator re-ranks out the Local Process Models by taking into account a new diversity score as well as the old LPM score

operator.name: Genetic Miner (Heuristics Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the Genetic Miner discovery algorithm.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the Genetic Miner algorithm which provides a Heuristics Net. As input a log file is needed.

operator.name: Repair Model (Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the repair model algorithm as defined in here.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the repair model algorithm which provides a repaired Petri net as result. As input an event log and a Petri Net are needed.

operator.name: Reduce Silent Transitions (Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to reduce silent transitions using the Murata rules, as defined in here.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the reduce silent transitions algorithm which returns a Petri net. As input a Petri Net is needed.

operator.name: Export Petri net
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to export a Petri Net to a (E)PNML file.
operator.help: This operator can be used to export a Petri Net to a (E)PNML file. As Petri Net is needed as an input.

operator.name: Export Data Petri net
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to export a Data Petri Net to a PNML file.
operator.help: This operator can be used to export a Data Petri Net to a PNML file.

operator.name: Export Event Log
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to export an event log.
operator.help: This operator can be used to export a event log. As log format XES, XES.GZ, MXML, and MXML.GZ are available. As input this operator needs an event log.

operator.name: Export Static Event Stream
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to export a static event stream.

operator.name: Event Log to Data Table (Exampleset)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to convert a ProM log into an Exampleset (data table).
operator.help: This operator can be used to convert a ProM log into an Exampleset. As input a log is needed. Each event of the log is converted into a single row in the Exampleset. Trace attributes are repeated in each row that is created for an event of that trace.

operator.name: Data Table to Event Log (XLog)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to convert an Exampleset (data table) into an ProM log.
operator.help: This operator can be used to convert an Exampleset into an ProM log. As input an Exampleset is needed. Each row of the exampleset is converted into a event belonging to a trace. For the conversion it is important that the following columns exist: T:concept:name (the concept name attribute of the trace), E:concept:name (the concept name attribute of the event), E:lifecycle:transition (the life cycle attribute of the event), E:org:resource (the resource attribute of the event), E:org:role (the role attribute of the event), E:org:group (the group attribute of the event), and E:time:time (the time attribute of the event).

operator.name: Heuristics Net to Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to convert a Heuristics Net into a Petri Net.
operator.help: This operator can be used to convert a Heuristics Net into a Petri Net. As input a Heuristics Net is needed.

operator.name: Evolutionary Tree Miner (Process Tree)
operator.synopsis: Discovers a Process Tree from an event log using the Evolutionary Tree Miner. The Evolutionary Tree Miner (or ETM) is an evolutionary algorithm to discover a process model (in our case a process tree) from an event log. It does so by creating several process models, checking how good they are (w.r.t the event log) using several quality dimensions, and then slightly modifying the best ones in the hope that they will become even better. By repeating this, and always keeping a list of the best ones found so far, the ETM will discover better and better process models. The main advantage is that many quality dimensions can be used to define what a �better� process model is.
operator.help: Mine a Process Using the ETM Algorithm from an event log.

operator.name: Process Tree to Petri Net
operator.synopsis: Convert a Process Tree into a Petri Net.
operator.help: Convert a Process Tree into a Petri Net.

operator.name: Analyze Performance (Manifest)
operator.synopsis: A log is replayed on a petri net to get performance information. This operator projects performance measurements in a process model such as bottlenecks.
operator.help: A log is replayed on a petri net to get performance and conformance information.

operator.name: Heuristics Miner (Heuristics Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the Heuristics Miner algorithm.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the Heuristics Miner. algorithm which provides a Heuristics Net. As input a log file is needed.

operator.name: Inductive Miner (Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the Inductive Miner in order to discover a Petri Net as defined here.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the Inductive Miner algorithm which provides a Petri Net. As input an event log is needed.

operator.name: Inductive Miner (Process Tree)
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to execute the Inductive Miner in order to discover a Process Tree as defined here.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute the Inductive Miner algorithm which provides a Process Tree. As input an event log is needed.

operator.name: Social Network Miner (Social Network)
operator.synopsis: This plugin reads an event log and generates social networks that can be used as a starting point for SNA. We can apply several techniques to analyze the social networks, e.g., find interaction patterns, evaluate the role of an individual in an organization, etc.
operator.help: An event log is requires as input

operator.name: Create Abstraction Model
operator.synopsis: Creates an abstraction model for abstracting events using a supervised pattern-based approach.
operator.help: Creates a combined abstraction model from process/abstraction patterns. Abstraction patterns describe the behavior expected for an (abstract) activity and should be modeled as Data Petri Net (DPN) with a single source and a single sink place (SESE stucture). This plug-in implements part of the the methodology presented in the BPM'16 paper 'From Low-Level Events to Activities - A Pattern-based Approach' (DOI: 10.1007/978-3-319-45348-4_8).

operator.name: Compile Abstraction Model to DPN
operator.synopsis: Compiles the abstraction model to its plain Data Petri net representation.
operator.help: Compiles the abstraction model to its plain Data Petri net representation.

operator.name: Log Abstraction Based on Patterns
operator.synopsis: Abstracts events from the supplied event log using a supervised pattern-based approach.
operator.help: Abstracts events from the supplied event log using a supervised pattern-based approach. This plug-in implements the methodology presented in the BPM'16 paper 'From Low-Level Events to Activities - A Pattern-based Approach' (DOI: 10.1007/978-3-319-45348-4_8). Activity patterns describe the behavior expected for an (abstract) activity and should be modeled as Data Petri Net (DPN) with a single source and a single sink place (SESE stucture).

operator.name: Expand Model Based on Patterns
operator.synopsis: Expands model based on abstraction patterns.
operator.help: Expands model based on abstraction patterns. The abstract activities are replaced by the low-level patterns.

operator.name: Add Noise
operator.synopsis: This filter randomly adds noise to the log.
operator.help: This operator can be used to add specific noise to a log. Check the parameter descriptions for more info on how noise is added. An event log is required as input.

operator.name: Add Table Column to XLog
operator.synopsis: This operator adds a column of an example set to an XLog.
operator.help: This operator adds a column of an example set to an XLog. As input a log file and an example set is needed.

operator.name: Add Trace Attributes to Log
operator.synopsis: This operator adds trace attributes to a log.
operator.help: This operator adds trace attributes (that are contained in an exampleset) to a log. For each trace only one row in the exampleset exists. In the exampleset one row needs to contain the (unique) case identifiers of the traces. As input a log file and an exampleset is needed.

operator.name: Add Event Attributes to Log
operator.synopsis: This operator adds event attributes to a log.
operator.help: This operator adds event attributes (that are contained in an exampleset) to a log. For each event only one row in the exampleset exists. In the exampleset one column needs to contain the case identifiers of the traces and another column needs to contain the (unique) event identifiers. As input a log file and an exampleset is needed.

operator.name: Add Events to Log
operator.synopsis: This operator adds events to a log.
operator.help: This operator adds events (that are contained in an exampleset) to a log. For each event only one row in the exampleset exists. In the exampleset, separate columns need to contain the following information: case identifiers, concept:name of the events, lifecycle:transition of the events, time:timestamp of the events, org:resource of the events, org:role of the events, group:resource of the events. In case a column with information is not present, no value needs to be filled in. As input a log file and an exampleset is needed.

operator.name: Create Prefix Closure
operator.synopsis: This operator creates a prefix-closure of the event log. For each trace, each prefix, excluding the empty prefix, is added.
operator.help: This operator creates a prefix-closure of the event log. For each trace, each prefix, excluding the empty prefix, is added.

operator.name: Merge Event Logs
operator.synopsis: This operator merges two event logs.
operator.help: This operator merges two event logs by collecting all the traces into a consolidated event log. As input two logs are needed.

operator.name: Merge Subsequent Events
operator.synopsis: This operator merges subsequent events in an event log.
operator.help: This operator merges subsequent events in an event log into one single event based on different criteria. For example, a trace [A,A,A,B,B,C,A,A] is transformed to [A,B,C,A].

operator.name: Move Trace Attributes to Trace
operator.synopsis: Moves all attributes that appear in every event with the same value to the trace level.
operator.help: Moves all attributes that appear in every event with the same value to the trace level, i.e., creates an attribute with that value for the trace.

operator.name: Remove Duplicate Attribute Values
operator.synopsis: Removes duplicate attribute values from events, i.e., attribute that have not change since the last event occurred.
operator.help: Removes duplicate attribute values from events, i.e., attribute that have not change since the last event occurred. This creates a smaller sparse event log, which is useful to reduce the memory consumption.

operator.name: Random Sample of Traces
operator.synopsis: Extracts a random sample of traces from the event log.
operator.help: Extracts a random sample of traces from the event log. The size of the sample can be given.

operator.name: Filter Events
operator.synopsis: Filters the events of an event log.
operator.help: Filters the events of an event log using a filter query.

operator.name: Filter Traces
operator.synopsis: Filters the traces of an event log.
operator.help: Filters the traces of an event log using a filter query.

operator.name: Add Classifier to Event Log
operator.synopsis: This operator adds an event classifier to an event log. An event classifier defines how events are identified.
operator.help: An event log is needed as input.

operator.name: Add Artificial Start and End Event
operator.synopsis: This operator adds a start and end event to each trace.
operator.help: This operator adds a start and end event to each trace. As input a log is needed.

operator.name: Add Elapsed Time
operator.synopsis: This operator adds the time elapsed since trace start to each event.
operator.help: This operator adds the time elapsed since trace start to each event. The time resolution can be chosen.

operator.name: Transition System Miner (Transition System)
operator.synopsis: This operator mines a transition system based on the selected parameters, as defined here.
operator.help: A log is required as input

operator.name: Fuzzy Miner (Fuzzy Model)
operator.synopsis: This operator mines a Fuzzy Model as described here. This miner is best suited for flexible or unstructured processes, where other miners give very complex models as result.
operator.help: A log is required for input

operator.name: Compute Prefix Alignments (Incremental)
operator.synopsis: Computes all prefix alignments of all traces in an incremental fashion

operator.name: Compute Prefix Alignments (Incremental / Prefix Aware)
operator.synopsis: Computes all prefix alignments of all traces in an incremental fashion

operator.name: Generate Event Stream from CPN
operator.synopsis: Generate stream from CPN

operator.name: Generate Event Stream from Static Event Stream
operator.synopsis: Generate an event stream from a static event stream.

operator.name: Stream Alpha Miner (Accepting Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: Discover a Petri net from an event stream using a stream-based implementation of the alpha miner

operator.name: Stream Inductive Miner (Accepting Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: Discover a Petri net from an event stream using a stream-based implementation of the inductive miner

operator.name: Stream Inductive Miner (Process Tree)
operator.synopsis: Discover a process tree from an event stream using a stream-based implementation of the inductive miner

operator.name: Event Stream Algorithm Analyzer (Projected Recall Precision, Accepting Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: Calculates Model to Model similarity of stream based discovery algorithms.
operator.help: Calculates model-to-model similarity of each generated model of each connected algorithm at each point in time w.r.t. a collection of reference models. The reported metrics are: recall and precision.

operator.name: Convert XLog to Static Event Stream
Event Stream Algorithm Analyzer (Alignments, Accepting Petri Net)
operator.synopsis: Calculates alignments of stream based discovery algorithms.
operator.help: Calculates alignments of each generated model of each connected algorithm at each point in time w.r.t. a collection of reference event logs. The reported metrics are: replay-fitness, precision, and, generalization

operator.name: Extract Static Event Stream
operator.synopsis: This operator allows for extracting a static event stream from a live event stream.
operator.help: This operator allows for extracting a static event stream from a live event stream. The static event stream can be used repeatedly (i.e. for repeated experiments). The user needs to specify how many packets should be captured by the extractor. The primary input is an (inactive) event stream. As a secondary, optional, input an author object can be given. If the author is not started yet the operator will start the underlying author.

operator.name: Start Runnable
operator.synopsis: This operator allows to start a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.)
operator.help: This operator allows to start a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.). It takes a runnable entity as an input and tries to start it. Optionally one can add multiple input objects such that starting the generator is postponed until these objects are ready. If the objects themselves are runnable, the operator will try to start them. Using this operator allows us to use stream based operators within a loop environment.

operator.name: Stop Runnable
operator.synopsis: This operator allows to stop a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.)
operator.help: This operator allows to stop a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.). It takes a runnable entity as an input and tries to stop it. Optionally one can add multiple input objects such that stopping the generator is postponed until these objects are ready. If the objects themselves are runnable, the operator will try to stop them. Using this operator allows us to use stream based operators within a loop environment.

operator.name: Poll Runnable
operator.synopsis: This operator allows to poll a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.)
operator.help: This operator allows to poll a runnable entity from the stream framework (i.e. generator, stream algorithm etc.). The operator checks whether the entity is still active. If the entity has become inactive, the operator will pass the entity on as an output object. This operator can be used within repeated experiments of stream related operators

operator.name: Store as Event Log (Finite)
operator.synopsis: Allows us to store the data on the event stream as an event log. The storage is finite, so at some point previous behaviour is removed from internal storage and thus from the generated event log!
operator.help: Allows us to store the data on the event stream as an event log. The storage is finite, so at some point previous behaviour is removed from internal storage and thus from the generated event log!

operator.name: Extract Case Data
operator.synopsis: This extracts data from the traces contained in an event log, such as relative occurrence, etc...
operator.help: This extracts data from the traces contained in an event log, such as relative occurrence, etc...

operator.name: Reduce Petri Net
operator.synopsis: This operator can be used to reduce a petri using the Murata rules, as defined in here. Note that this is an agressive reduction that most probably will remove non-silent transitions from the net. This type of reduction, however, facilitates soundness checking since the structural properties of the net are preserved. Hence, a soundness analysis obtained for a reduced Petri net is valid also for the original net.
operator.help: This operator can be used to execute Murata reduction algorithm which returns a Petri net. As input a Petri Net is needed.

operator.name: Free Memory (RapidProM)
operator.synopsis: This operator tries to free the memory used by RapidProM (and also Rapid Miner itself).
operator.help: This operator tries to free the memory used by RapidProM (and also Rapid Miner itself). It does so by clearing the Plugin Context object (which is originating from the ProM framework, i.e., the base of RapidProM)

operator.name: DAPOQ-Lang Query
operator.synopsis: Executes a DAPOQ-Lang Query on a SLEX Meta Model
operator.help: A SLEX Meta Model is required as input

operator.name: SLEXMM Meta Model Importer
operator.synopsis: Imports a SLEX Meta Model
operator.help: A file is required as input

operator.name: SLEXMM Meta Model Generator
operator.synopsis: Generates a SLEX Meta Model from several inputs
operator.help: A Data Model, a set of events and versions, logs and process definitions are required as input

operator.name: PADAS Log Splitter
operator.synopsis: Split a set of events into traces according to some criteria
operator.help: A Data Model and a set of events are required as input

operator.name: DAPOQ-Lang Result to ExampleSet
operator.synopsis: Transforms the results of a DAPOQ-Lang query into an ExampleSet
operator.help: A result of a DAPOQ-Lang query is required as input

operator.name: Select Default XFactory
operator.synopsis: Select the default XFactory that is used to create event logs.
operator.help: Select the default XFactory that is used to create event logs.

operator.name: Creates a Transitions and Event Classes Mapping
operator.synopsis: Converts an example set with columns 'transition', 'eventclass' to a ProM mapping.
operator.help: Converts an example set with columns 'transition', 'eventclass' to a ProM mapping.

operator.name: GED between Causal nets
operator.synopsis: Compute the graph edit distance between two Causal nets.
operator.help: Compute the graph edit distance between two Causal nets based on the approach published in: Dijkman, Remco, Marlon Dumas, and Luciano Garcia-Banuelos. Graph matching algorithms for business process model similarity search. BPM 2009

operator.name: GED between Petri nets
operator.synopsis: Compute the graph edit distance between two Petri nets.
operator.help: Compute the graph edit distance between two Petri nets based on the approach published in: Dijkman, Remco, Marlon Dumas, and Luciano Garcia-Banuelos. Graph matching algorithms for business process model similarity search. BPM 2009

operator.name: GED between Petri nets
operator.synopsis: Compute the graph edit distance between two Petri nets.
operator.help: Compute the graph edit distance between two Petri nets based on the approach published in: Dijkman, Remco, Marlon Dumas, and Luciano Garcia-Banuelos. Graph matching algorithms for business process model similarity search. BPM 2009

operator.name: Causal net to Petri net
operator.synopsis: Converts a Causal net into a Petri net representation.
operator.help: Converts a Causal net into a Petri net representation.

operator.name: Clean up Threads (RapidProM)
operator.synopsis: This operator kills all threads which seems to be spawned by RapidProM operators that were not killed properly. WARNING: might kill too much leading to unexpected behavior.
operator.help: This operator kills all threads which seems to be spawned by RapidProM operators that were not killed properly. WARNING: might kill too much leading to unexpected behavior.

operator.name: Export Causal net
operator.synopsis: Exports a Causal net to a XML file.
operator.help: Exports a Causal net to a XML file..

operator.name: Import Causal net
operator.synopsis: Imports a Causal net from a file.
operator.help: Imports a Causal net from a file.

operator.name: Detect Concept Drift (Decision Point Analysis)
operator.synopsis: This is a synopsis
operator.help: help is coming!

operator.name: Detect Concept Drift (QUT)
operator.synopsis: this is a synopsis
operator.help: help is coming!

operator.name: Measure Concept Drift
operator.synopsis: this is a synopsis
operator.help: help is coming!

operator.name: Generate Event Log from Newick Tree
Generate Event Log from Petri Net
operator.synopsis: this is a synopsis
operator.help: help is coming!

operator.name: Generate Event Log With Concept Drift
Convert Newick Tree to Process Tree
Generate Noisy Log (Event Level)
operator.synopsis: This operator creates a log with noise: each trace of the original log is modified until it no longer fits the given petri net.

operator.name: Generate Noisy Log (Trace Level)
operator.synopsis: This operator creates a log with noise: each trace of the original log is modified until it no longer fits the given petri net.

operator.name: Log Cross Validation
operator.synopsis: This operator splits an event log and does k-fold cross validation
operator.help: An Event log is required as input

operator.name: Split Log
operator.synopsis: This operator splits an event log in two sublogs according to the split ratio
operator.help: An Event log is required as input

operator.name: Number of Unique Paths
operator.synopsis: This operator calculate the number of unique paths within a process tree
operator.help: The output is an exampleset with a single cell containing the number of unique paths of the process tree given as input, and the parameter value.

operator.name: Boolean Conformance checker
operator.synopsis: This operator replays an event log into a Petri net, and it decides whether traces perfectly fit the model (1) or not (0).
operator.help: The output is an exampleset with a row for each trace, indicating if it fits the petri net or not.

operator.name: Count Unique Traces
operator.synopsis: This operator counts the unique traces in a log according to the specified classifier.
operator.help: The output is an exampleset with the number of unique traces in the input log.

operator.name: Plugin Context Size
operator.synopsis: This operator measures the size of the connection manager and provided object manager
operator.help: The output is an exampleset with the size of both.

operator.name: Filter RPST
operator.synopsis: Filters the RPST by collapsing node until a specified minimum size of each RPST fragment is reached.
operator.help: Filters the RPST by collapsing node until a specified minimum size of each RPST fragment is reached.

operator.name: Extract Leafs from RPST
operator.synopsis: Extracts the leafs of a (possibly filtered) RPST as Petri Nets.
operator.help: Extracts the leafs of a (possibly filtered) RPST as Petri Nets

operator.name: Generate Event Stream from Event Log
operator.synopsis: Allows us to convert an event log into an event stream
operator.help: Allows us to convert an event log into an event stream. We can use timestamps or simply the ordering as described by the event log for event ordering on the stream. We are also able to include additional event payload.

operator.name: (Deprecated) Trie Based Spurious Event Filter
operator.synopsis: Filter spurious events from a given event stream

operator.name: Spurious Event Filter
operator.synopsis: Filter spurious events from a given event stream

operator.name: Generate Spurious Events
operator.synopsis: Adds spurious events to an event log, i.e. events of which we are sure they are not able to be executed at that position
operator.help: TBD
